short_description: Experience the diverse landscapes, rich history, and vibrant culture of Venezuela, where towering mountains, stunning beaches, and unique wildlife await. Hike to the summit of Mount Roraima, relax on the beaches of Margarita Island, or explore the colonial town of Coro

weather.title: Venezuela has a tropical climate with high temperatures and humidity year-round. It experiences a wet season from May to November, with heavy rainfall, while the dry season from December to April offers drier conditions

when_to_visit.title: Dry season
when_to_visit.short_description: Less rainfall and more sunny fays, making it ideal for beach visits and exploring natural attractions

when_to_visit.title: Best for wildlife
when_to_visit.short_description: Popular time for wildlife viewing and birdwatching in Venezuela's national parks, such as Canaima National Park and Los Roques Archipelago National Park

when_to_visit.title: Rainy season
when_to_visit.short_description: More frequent rainfall, especially in the northern and western regions. Still possible to visit during this time but be prepared for rain showers

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Venezuela depends on the region, but generally, the months of December to April offer drier conditions, pleasant temperatures, and opportunities to explore the country's natural wonders, including Angel Falls and the Amazon rainforest
